duties_responsibilities.duty: Assisting physicians and nurses in providing patient care.
Obtaining vital signs, weights, and EKGs when needed, and all other tests within the scope of the practice.
Assisting with blood collection/phlebotomy as needed.
Maintaining patient flow to and from exam rooms and treatment areas.
Escorting patients and specimens throughout the facility.
Ensuring chart is available, with relevant lab work and test reports if indicated, for the physician when the physician sees the patient.
Stocking exam room/treatment rooms with medical supplies, linen, and designated chart forms.
Cleaning and sterilizing designated equipment after use.
Assisting with light housekeeping duties including spills.
Completing patient charges as per policy.
Assisting patient with obtaining food, toileting, ambulating, and maintaining comfort.
Assisting physicians with procedures e.g. GI procedures, all medical exams.
Answering telephone in treatment area and assisting staff in scheduling treatments.

education_certification.credential: High School Diploma or equivalent. Completion of a Medical Assistant Program from an accredited institution OR upon hire hold a current medical assistant Certification from a Nationally Recognized accredited institution (e.g. American Association of Medical Assistant (AAMA); American Medical Technologies (AMT); National Center for Competency Testing (NCCT); National Healthcare Association (NHA))
